knxUltimate.title: KNX Device

properties.node-input-initialread1: Read from KNX BUS (to receive the response from BUS, enable also -React to response telegrams-)
properties.node-input-initialread2: Read the last value saved to file prior to disconnection
properties.node-input-initialread3: Read the last value saved to file prior to disconnection. If the file is missing, read from KNX BUS (to receive the response from BUS, enable also -React to response telegrams-)
properties.node-input-notifyreadrequestalsorespondt: Auto send node value as response to the BUS
properties.node-input-listenallga: Universal mode (listen to all Group Addresses)
properties.node-input-outputRBE: Send payload to KNX only if changed (RBE filter)
properties.node-input-inputRBE: React only by changed payload (RBE filter)

placeholder.leaveempty: Leave empty to use Group Address
placeholder.notifyreadrequestalsorespondtobusdefault: Ex: 0 for false, 1 for true, otherwise any value

button.enable: Show manual command button in editor

headings.from_input_to_bus: From node's INPUT PIN to KNX BUS
headings.from_bus_to_output: From KNX BUS to node's OUTPUT PIN

snippets.select: Select a snippet to be inserted

dptDetails.noSample: Currently, no sample payload is available.

advanced.Formatting: Format INPUT (datagram coming from the KNX BUS)
advanced.Operations: NUMERIC VALUES (operations are performed in order)
advanced.NUMERICVALUES: NUMERIC VALUES (operations are performed in order)
advanced.noETSWarning:
You haven't imported the ETS csv file.
The node will work as blind transmitter/receiver. Click here for help about that.
advanced.notify-DPT3007: You selected a relative DIM. Please click here to view this sample and learn how to handle such payload.
advanced.notify-DPT18001: You selected a scene Datapoint. Please click here to view this sample and learn how to handle such payload.
advanced.notify-NoETSFile: Universal mode needs a valid ETS file to be able to decode datatypes and output device names. Please paste the ETS file in the config node. If you don't use ETS file, the node will work as blind receiver (with automatic deconding of the datagrams) but you need to pass the datatype (besides the value) in the input message to be able to send something to the KNX BUS.
advanced.notify-DPT232600: You selected an RGB Datapoint. Please click here to view this sample and learn how to handle such payload.
advanced.notify-DPT251600: You selected an RGBW Datapoint. Please click here to view this sample and learn how to handle such payload.
advanced.notify-DPT222: You selected an 3x16 Bit Datapoint. Please click here to view this sample and learn how to handle such payload.
advanced.divVediEsempi: PLEASE TAKE 5 MINUTES TO SEE SOME SAMPLES
advanced.Sample: Help example of the selected datapoint

selectlists.Output_update: No output. Update only (updates the value without sending any telegram to the KNX BUS)
selectlists.SetTopic_listenAllGA: Universal mode (listen to all Group Addresses)
selectlists.Negatives_abs: Output absolute value (remove the minus sign)
selectlists.passthrough_OwnProp: Yes, but put the input msg into msg.inputmessage property of the output message
selectlists.RBE_out_enable: Enable (send the payload to KNX only if changed)

knxUltimate.manualReadError: Unable to send KNX read request
